Build Identifier: Linux Firefox/0.8

Downloaded 0.8 for linux (rh 9).  Unarchived to /usr/local.  I have Mozilla
1.2.1 under /usr/bin, and want to be able to keep on using it - at least for
email.  When I run firefox, it opens fine.  When I run /usr/bin/mozilla, it
opens firefox!  Even if I delete the firefox directory, it still opens a window
with "firefox" in the titlebar. And I can't run /usr/bin/mozilla -mail
successfully either.  If I reboot, after deleting firefox, I can run mozilla
again.  How can I get linux (kde) to run both browsers?  The kde desktop browser
link also runs firefox instead of mozilla even though it is pointing at
/usr/bin/mozilla.

Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce:
1.run /usr/bin/mozilla with firefox installed on the system
2.
3.

Actual Results:  
firefox opens instead of mozilla browser or mozilla messenger.

Expected Results:  
mozilla browser or messenger should have opened instead of firefox.

comments.raw_text:
what's happening is that older versions of xremote didn't differentiate between
different Mozilla processes (because the app was a single process, this didn't
matter).  _Any_ ping response from another process with xremote would match the
criteria, and the red hat startup script basically is finding firefox, thinking
its mozilla, and passing a "open new window" command to firefox using -remote.

xremote (and hopefully the red hat startup script) has since been updated to
understand the difference.  Firefox's startup script in current nightly builds
does this automatically, but we can't fix Moz 1.2.1.
comments.creator: mconnor@mozilla.com
